title: Geneseo Fire Protection District RFP for Dual Band Portable 700/800 VHF STARCOM Radios

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Puerto Rico public records law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, proposals, and related submissions provided to the Geneseo Fire Protection District in response to the solicitation R-20250818-1081 for Dual Band Portable 700/800 VHF STARCOM Radios, published on August 15, 2025.

Specifically, please provide any and all proposals, bids, supporting documents, correspondence, or evaluation materials submitted by vendors or respondents for this RFP.

If any portion of the requested records is withheld due to statutory exemptions, please specify the exact exemption and provide the remaining non-exempt records.

Please provide the documents in electronic format if available. I appreciate your timely response in accordance with the FOIA statutory deadline.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael Tillman

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of July 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of July 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: FBI File(s) on the late journalist Ross Gelbspan

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI File(s) on the late journalist Ross Gelbspan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all segregable and releasable FBI records pertaining to the deceased journalist ROSS GELBSPAN (Born: 1939; Date of Death: January 27, 2024) who spent 31 years as a reporter and editor at various newspapers, including The Philadelphia Bulletin, The Washington Post, the Village Voice and The Boston Globe. Obituaries on Gelbspan can be seen at The New York Times; The Washington Post and Legacy.com.

- https://www.nytimes.com/2024/02/16/business/media/ross-gelbspan-dead.html
- https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2024/02/17/ross-gelbspan-climate-journalist-dies/
- https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/bostonglobe/name/ross-gelbspan-obituary?id=54265222

This search is to include each of the following record stores and interfaces: the Central Records System (CRS), the Automated Case Support system ("ACS"), Investigative Case Management system ("ICM"), the Automated Case Support system ("ACS"), Electronic Case File ("ECF"), and the Automated Case Support system ("ACS") Universal Index ("UNI").

I also request a search of "ELSUR", the database containing electronic surveillance information, for any and all records or activities related to Gelbspan for any on-line account or address or associated service. In addition, please extend the search criteria across any external storage media, including I-Drives, S-Drives, or related technologies used during the course of investigation. Please include processing notes, even if this request is denied in part. Please identify individuals responsible for any aspect of FOIA processing in the processing notes, along with explanation of their involvement if not typically assigned FOIA responsibilities for the record systems above. Please include materials responsive to this request from the bureau's Massachusetts field offices, if possible, to reduce overlap with field office requests.

Note, also: I am a freelance reporter and would request that any relevant fees be waived. My past work has appeared in The Daily Mail, The New York Times, New York magazine's Intelligencer blog, Scientific American, Slate.com, the New Republic, the New York Review of Books, Chemical Engineering magazine, and elsewhere.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Phelan

title: The Burns', Jeffrey Epstein & Ghislaine Maxwell (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: The Burns', Jeffrey Epstein & Ghislaine Maxwell (Central Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Any and all records relating to the meetings between ex-CIA director William Burns. According to https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-news/cia-director-noam-chomsky-epstein-calendar-1234726393/ The calendar showed that in 2014, while current CIA director William Burns was deputy secretary of state, Burns had three meetings scheduled with Epstein, first meeting in Washington and then at Epstein’s Manhattan townhouse. Rumors and accusations have long swirled around Epstein that he was some kind of intelligence asset.

2.) Any and all records relating to Thomas E. Burns Jr., according to https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/rosiegray/jeffrey-epstein-state-department “As you are aware, Mr. Epstein’s apparent departure from the house and his failure to make timely rental payments in February and March of this year have been matters of serious concern to this office,” wrote Thomas E. Burns Jr., then the deputy director of the Office of Foreign Missions, in April 1996 in a letter attached to court filings. Burns wrote that the OFM had already found someone to take over the lease from Epstein, a developer named Xenophon Galinas, and that they would not approve the sublease to Fisher.

3.) Any and all records relating to Ghislaine Maxwell and her alias "Dana Burns". According to https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/10469504/prince-andrew-ghislaine-maxwell-virginia/ "Then there is Ellmax, a company she set up in 2012. Its registered UK address is a cottage in Wiltshire occupied by Catherine Vaughan Edwards, another old friend. Its U.S. base is Maxwell’s New York flat, via one ‘Dana Burns’, which appears to be an alias that Ghislaine uses." https://web.archive.org/web/20250729205211/https://static.foxnews.com/foxnews.com/content/uploads/2024/01/10.pdf

4.) Any and all records regarding FBI Special Agent Brian A. Burns, Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. Upon information and belief, Agent Burns was an FBI Agent in Tennessee before being relocated to Buffalo, NY.
https://www.actionnews5.com/story/6358294/fbi-agent-says-bureau-didnt-know-about-tim-willis-side-project-during-waltz/
https://artvoice.com/2016/09/judge-pietruszka-role-assigning-counsel-witness-fbi-tried-flip-pigeon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

title: Facility operating budgets

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Facility operating budgets
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The SFY 2024–25 facility operating budgets of every DOCCS facility.

By “facility operating budget,” I mean the spending plans or allocations of operating funds for individual facilities. DOCCS’s own directives indicate such records are maintained, including:
• Directive 2700 (Budget & Finance), which describes a department-wide spending plan that divides funds among facilities and regions; and
• Directive 2915, which refers to facility operating funds and purchases funded from the facility’s operating budget.

If no “budget” record exists at the facility level, please provide the facility-level operating expenditure (actuals) reports for the same year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Akash Mehta

title: Citiguard Vehicle Pursuit at CoreCivic Detention Center in Caliofornia City, CA

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Citiguard Vehicle Pursuit at CoreCivic Detention Center in Caliofornia City, CA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request is for the Bureau of Security and Investigative Services (BSIS) of California. 

Context: A video widely circulated on social media shows two individuals approaching a CoreCivic Detention Center in California City, CA On September 2, 2025. A uniformed security patrol officer in a Citiguard vehicle approached them. The security officer asks them to stop recording and leave property, and then appears to initiate a vehicle pursuit in a Citiguard marked patrol vehicle on public roads that reach reported speeds of 70mph to 100mph. According to BSIS's website, Citiguard's owner is GHARZAI NOMAIR, and Citiguard has two  previous citations for employing non-licensed security officers. 

As such, I am requesting the following:
1) Citiguard's License, Certificates, or other verification documents that indicate their authority to work in California City, CA
2) Citiguard's current Private Patrol Operator application and/or most recent renewal application, packet, or documentation submitted to achieve BSIS licensure for license 121572, and for any branch or other licenses that permit Citiguard's operations within California City, CA. 
3) Any complaints, investigations, notices, or tips related to Citiguard from January 2024 through the date of completion of this request 
4) Any emails that your office has received or sent relating to the September 2nd, 2025 incident involving Citiguard at the CoreCivic Detention Center
5) Any Citiguard policies relating to foot or vehicle pursuits, use of force continuum, verbal de-escalation, or patrol SOPs that are in your possession

This is a newsworthy event, I respectfully request that you expedite this request to the extent possible. You may send documents as they become available. I appreciate you taking the time to fulfil this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

Good Afternoon,

This message serves to acknowledge that the City of Watertown received your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request on September 7, 2025, seeking the mugshot and possible body cam footage of Edwin A. Morones, whom was arrested in LeRay, NY on February 1st 2025 for distributing Child Exploitation Material.

The City of Watertown has determined that it does not maintain, possess, or have custody of the records you have requested, as the location referenced in your request is outside the City of Watertown's jurisdiction. title: Cancellation of Tom Hanks’s Thayer Award ceremony and related events

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Cancellation of Tom Hanks’s Thayer Award ceremony and related events
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer:  

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. 

On September 25, 2025, the West Point Association of Graduates was scheduled to host a visit, ceremony, dinner, and parade at West Point for actor and veteran’s advocate Tom Hanks. Hanks is to receive the Sylvanus Thayer Award,  West Point’s highest civilian honor. This week, Washington Post reported that West Point will cancel all of these celebratory activities. https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2025/09/06/tom-hanks-west-point/

Please produce all documents related to the cancellation of the events honoring Mr. Hanks. These would include, without limitation, all documents related to the decision to cancel the events. Please ensure that the documents are sufficient to identify all persons who made or participated in making the decision to cancel the events, and documents sufficient to identify all reasons for canceling the events. Responsive records would include, without limitation, emails, text messages, and any other electronic messages (e.g. Signal). Thank you.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: MS Fire Marshal Office & Insurance Dept State Vehicle GPS Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All data collected via GPS tracker devices from state-owned vehicles of the Mississippi Insurance Department (MID) including but not limited to all vehilcles utilized and/or managed by Divisions of MID such as the State Fire Marshal's Office , for the period January 1, 2024 through September 1, 2025. This includes data generated by Linxup OBD GPS devices and/or any successor or replacement GPS tracking systems and should uniquely ID each vehicle by state issued asset or inventory number.

Please provide the data in Excel (.xlsx) or CSV format as a bulk extract from the GPS service provider, which should be immediately available in electronic form with minimal effort.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

MSPublic DataInfo

communications.subject: FW: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: MS Fire Marshal Office & Insurance Dept State Vehicle GPS Data
communications.communication:
Muck Rock News a/k/a MSPublic DataInfo:

The Mississippi Insurance Department received the records request you submitted dated September 8, 2025, which is set out in the below email chain.

The Mississippi Insurance Department and its subdivision, the State Fire Marshal's Office, (hereinafter referred to jointly as MID) does not maintain the data from the GPS tracker devices in the form you are requesting.  The Mississippi Public Records act of 1983 only requires the production of records that exist, and does not require the creation of the document you are requesting.  Consequently, we have no records that are responsive to your request.

Furthermore, with regard to the underlying data from GPS tracker devices, to the extent there is any responsive record, your request for records is being denied.  The records you are requesting constitutes private information of law enforcement, judicial and prosecutorial personnel and are exempt from disclosure pursuant to § 25-61-12 of the Miss. Code of 1972, as amended, and 19 Miss. Admin. Code, Part 1, Chapter 13, Rule 13.06(B)(13), which provides exemptions including but not limited to:  a. data compiled in the process of detecting and investigating any unlawful activity or alleged unlawful activity, the disclosure would harm such investigation; c. release of the information would impede the public body's enforcement, investigative or detection efforts; d. would disclose investigative techniques; and f. could endanger the life or safety of a public official or law enforcement personnel.

You may appeal the denial of your request to the Commissioner of Insurance, file a complaint with the Mississippi Ethics Commission, or may seek immediate judicial review of the denial in the Chancery Court.  An appeal to the Commissioner of Insurance shall be in writing, and shall include a statement of the circumstances, reasons or arguments advanced in support of disclosure, and a copy of any written denial issued.  See §25-61-13 of the Mississippi Code of 1972, as amended, and 19 Miss. Admin. Code, Part 1, Chapter 13, Rule 13.09 (Review of Denials).

The undersigned is responsible for this Response.  If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at (601) 359-1074.

MARK LAMPTON
Senior Attorney
Mississippi Insurance Department and
State Fire Marshal's Office
Mailing Address:  P.O. Box 79, Jackson, MS  39205-0079
Email:  mark.lampton@mid.ms.gov<mailto:mark.lampton@mid.ms.gov>
Tele:  (601)359-1074
Fax: (601)359-2474

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USS Liberty: Still Classified USS Liberty Documents Seen by X User @mdvtfan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the Israel Defense Force attacked our ship on June 8, 1967, and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.[https://ussliberty.org]

A user on X (formerly Twitter) is a DoD Contractor at Ft. Meade. He posted a comment telling us he saw still classified documents related to the attack on our ship.

His X id is @mdvtfan.

I’ve included screenshots of the relevant comments he made on X.

The URLs of his comments are https://x.com/mdvtfan/status/1964101066837946589 and https://x.com/mdvtfan/status/1964130923789664600

We ask that the still-classified documents related to the attack on our ship be declassified and released to us.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Interim US Attorney Ed Martin Letters to Georgetown University Law Center

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Interim US Attorney Ed Martin Letters to Georgetown University Law Center
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications between Interim United States Attorney Ed Martin and Georgetown University, Georgetown University Law Center, or William M. Treanor  between February 1, 2025 and May 8, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 28 CFR § 16.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and academic freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely a United States Attorney's initiation of an "inquiry" into the academic content of courses at a private law school.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles:

a. https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2025/03/05/dc-us-attorney-ed-martin-georgetown-law-dei/
b. https://thepostmillennial.com/us-atty-ed-martin-demands-georgetown-law-school-answer-for-dei-in-curriculum-hiring-and-programs
c. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/06/us/politics/ed-martin-us-attorney-washington-trump.html
d. https://thehill.com/homenews/education/5181345-georgetown-law-school-dei-trump/
e. https://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow-show/maddowblog/trump-appointed-prosecutor-gets-much-needed-refresher-first-amendment-rcna195321
f. https://www.rawstory.com/ed-martin-georgetown-clash/
g. https://reason.com/volokh/2025/03/07/may-government-refuse-to-hire-notre-dame-students-because-notre-dame-teaches-and-promotes-anti-abortion-ideology
h. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/mar/06/ed-martin-us-attorney-dei
i. https://www.newsmax.com/politics/georgetown-dei-william-treanor/2025/03/06/id/1201790/
j. https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/politics/federal-fallout/georgetown-law-school-wont-bow-to-dei-threat-from-dcs-acting-federal-prosecutor-ed-martin-donald-trump-william-treanor/65-22ac5a1d-43a8-492b-92db-1f8c6f70f76c
k. https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/columnist/2025/03/07/dei-georgetown-us-attorney-first-amendment/81793644007/
l. https://www.washingtonian.com/2025/03/07/william-treanor-georgetown-law-ed-martin-first-amendment/
m. https://abovethelaw.com/2025/03/georgetown-law-to-ed-martin-f-all-the-way-off/
n. https://www.thecollegefix.com/top-d-c-federal-prosecutor-says-he-doesnt-want-law-students-from-georgetown-because-of-dei/
o. https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2025/03/georgetown-william-treanor-ed-martin-trump-doj-dei.html
p. https://www.foxnews.com/media/georgetown-professors-slam-trumps-dei-crackdown-attack-religious-freedom-jesuit-schools

4. This information is relevant to a matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government's integrity that affect public confidence. There is widespread and exceptional media interest in this matter, as reflected in the above articles originating from outlets across the ideological spectrum. This matter raises "possible questions" about government integrity affecting public confidence because the alleged conduct involves a United States Attorney's pressure on a law school to limit viewpoints offered in classroom teaching protected by the First Amendment. A prominent First Amendment scholar has raised questions about the propriety of Attorney Martin's "inquiry." Eugene Volokh, "May Government Refuse to Hire Notre Dame Students, Because Notre Dame Teaches and Promotes Anti-Abortion Ideology?" (Volokh Conspiracy, March 7, 2025), https://reason.com/volokh/2025/03/07/may-government-refuse-to-hire-notre-dame-students-because-notre-dame-teaches-and-promotes-anti-abortion-ideology. Further, Attorney Martin's letter was sent as members of the United States Senate requested disciplinary action against Attorney Martin due to his similar efforts to suppress speech protected by the First Amendment. See https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/06/us/politics/ed-martin-us-attorney-washington-trump.html. 

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 28 CFR § 16.10(k), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by an Interim United States Attorney.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Post-2013 HAARP Records: Transfer, Operations, and Declassified Materials (Air Force)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Post-2013 HAARP Records: Transfer, Operations, and Declassified Materials (Air Force)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the High-Frequency Active Auroral Research Program (HAARP). I am aware of prior requests, including those in *Roman v. Dep't of the Air Force, No. 12-1381 (EGS) (D.D.C. 2013)*, which sought locations of HAARP devices and test dates. To avoid duplication, I seek only records created, declassified, or otherwise made available after July 9, 2013, including but not limited to:

1. Documents related to the transfer of HAARP facilities or operations to the University of Alaska Fairbanks in 2015 or later, including agreements, environmental impact assessments, and declassification reviews.
2. Reports, memoranda, emails, or cables concerning HAARP's goals, scope, testing dates, or additional facilities (beyond the known Gakona, Alaska site) from 2013 to the present, including any segregable portions of classified records.
3. Records referenced in the George W. Bush Presidential Library finding aid for FOIA 2014-0038-F, such as drafts of the U.S. Arctic Research Plan Biennial Revision: 2004–2008, or electronic records (e.g., TS emails from 2001-2008) that have been declassified and transferred to Air Force custody.
4. Any indexes, Vaughn lists, or descriptions of records withheld in the *Roman* case, including updates on their classification status post-2013.
5. Communications between the Air Force and other agencies (e.g., DARPA, Navy, NSF) regarding HAARP operations, funding, or research after 2013.
